page.title: 10 Farming around Occold
page.content: In our 12 squares we have seen a lot of arable land. Mostly we have seen wheat and barley. The barley is now coming into ear and turning yellow. Farmers usually start combining at the end of July and through August. The barley is about a metre high now. There are a few rape and sugar beet fields. Mr Hull lives on a dairy farm with cows on it. He milks the cows every day. He lives on a farm with 3 children. Their names are Tracy, Daniel and Michelle. Tracy and Michelle have got one horse each. They are called Coral and Misty. Before you milk a cow you have to make sure everything is clean. Mr Hull makes milk and butter with his wife. They live in Occold and their address is Church Farm, Occold, Eye, Suffolk.
